sen.j: 鷹司 祺子（たかつかさ やすこ、文化 (元号)8年2月25日 (旧暦)（1811年3月19日） - 弘化4年10月13日 (旧暦)（1847年11月20日））、のちの皇太后 祺子は、江戸時代後期の仁孝天皇の女御。
sen.e: Yasuko TAKATSUKASA (March 19, 1811 - November 20, 1847), later Empress Dowager Yasuko, was the nyogo (a court title of the Emperor's consort) of Emperor Ninko during the late Edo period.

sen.j: 文政6年（1823年）、仁孝天皇の女御であった姉繋子が難産のため26歳で早世。
sen.e: In 1823, her older sister Tsunako, who was Emperor Ninko's nyogo, died young at the age of 26 due to a difficult birth.

sen.e: Then, Yasuko had to enter into court as the second consort of the emperor at the age of 15 in 1825, and received senge (imperial proclamation) for Nyogo.

sen.j: それ以降子に恵まれなかったため、天保6年（1835年）、典侍正親町雅子所生の第四皇子熙宮（統仁親王、のちの孝明天皇）を養子とした。
sen.e: After that, Yasuko was not blessed with a newborn and so, in 1835, she adopted the fourth Prince 熙宮 (Imperial Prince Osahito, later Emperor Komei), who was the birth child of Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) Naoko OGIMACHI.

sen.e: In 1846, Emperor Ninko died and Imperial Prince Osahito, Yasuko's adopted child, ascended the throne.

sen.e: In April 1847, Yasuko became Empress Dowager because she was the biological mother of the new emperor, but on November 20, 1847 entered into priesthood and received senge for Nyoingo and then died on that day.
